alert.note: Alert for Anson; Montgomery; Moore; Randolph; Richmond; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 11:57PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Anson, Montgomery, Moore, Randolph, Richmond and Stanly. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1157 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albemarle, Troy, Badin Lake, Biscoe, Ansonville, Seagrove, Plyler, Locust, Norwood, Badin, Oakboro, Stanfield, Mount Gilead, Ellerbe, Star, Candor, Norman, Lake Tillery, Uwharrie Haven and Morrow Mountain State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Anson; Montgomery; Moore; Randolph; Richmond; Stanly
